data.title: Can't type numbers when editing HTML
data.body: Whenever I open an HTML file (in any fashion) for editing, I can't type numbers from the number pad or the number bar. I can work around this by copying the number I want and pasting it into my document.

data.title: "The editor has crashed" when opening .tpl file (which is from a git repo)
data.body: Earlier today I was using Atom to edit some HTML and PHP code and it was running smoothly and perfectly. Tonight for work I tried using Atom and it decided to crash every time I tried working with my tpl files. I then tried opening other html files and it worked just as smoothly as before.

data.title: opening keymap.cson adds home directory to project
data.body:
when opening keymap.cson or any other config file, my home folder is automatically added to the project and indexed, causing a massive performance hit (probably due to my linter as suggested in  #6437). removing the folder from the project view and then navigating back to the keymap.cson file adds the folder again. i've noticed this occuring seemingly randomly while working as well, but i have not been able to pin down any particular cause except this one.

i'm on ubuntu 14.04, atom v1.0.11

update: the bug seems to be present when opening or switching to anything in ~/.\* as well

data.title: "Open In Dev Mode..." doesn't open in dev mode when no files are open
data.body:
Atom: 1.0.11
Platform: Mac OS X 10.10.5
### Issue

When I have no files open, and use `View > Developer > Open In Dev Mode` to open a folder, that folder is opened, but not in dev mode. If I have any file opened, `Open In Dev Mode` works as expected/intended.

data.title: After splitting set the scrollbar to match the original
data.body:
Position the cursor 1 page down in a longer file then split the pane.  The new pain's scrollbar is set to top.  Instead it should scroll down to show the original code and cursor.

In other words, the cursor's position is correctly set after the split it is just not scrolling to make it visible.

EDIT: see acontreras89 below... new pane should match the original view (not the cursor, that may not be visible).   fyi, this is the behaviour I see in JEdit...

data.title: Remember code folding
data.body:
It would be great if Atom could remember code folding / collapse when a file closes and restored when reopened. 

I know Visual Studio supports this.

Ref: https://discuss.atom.io/t/remembering-collapse-expand-location-after-file-reopening/18155

data.title: [feature request] add tiny command-line as a builtin atom package
data.body:
I want tiny command line in atom.
Certainly, There are many command-line packages, but they not enough.
someone package is heavy, or another one does not accept `sudo`.
I want vim like command line in atom

data.title: Cannot install packages from keyboard without tabbing
data.body: After typing `install` in the command box and choosing `Install Packages and Themes` (which Atom abysmally ranks _last_ in the results), the Install pane opens, but one cannot type immediately because the search box doesn't have keyboard focus. Instead, the "Install" tab on the left pane does, and one must tab over at least twice. The search bar should obtain focus, at least in the case when the `Install Packages and Themes` command is chosen, and possibly in other cases. This is a minor inconvenience.

data.title: Opening a file and triggering an undo removes all content from the file
data.body:
Here's a GIF:

![undoooo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38924/9821745/8823d5be-58bc-11e5-9e7a-879013ffe65a.gif)

I start Atom, open a file, type something, and then trigger undos -- after the text I added is removed another undo removes all content from the file. Not the behavior I expected - I expect undo to only undo changes I made. I can reproduce this even when I don't type anything -- a single undo removes the content of the file. I'm on OSX 10.10.5, Atom 1.0.12-bc68056

cc @maxbrunsfeld I'm wondering if this might be related to the recent undo support across sessions?

data.title: Can't add text when I save file as with source file extension
data.body:
Hello Team, 

So I've noticed a weird behavior described below:
1. I open up atom.
2. Create a new file.
3. Save the file as maybe .java or .py
4. Try to add code, but it doesn't accept code.
5. I go to Sublime Text, open the same file, and I can add my code, that also appears on the atom version.

Can you please advise what this issue is?

data.title: Feature: Remove white space on enter to the right of the cursor
data.body:
I believe this is a very safe and hopefully an easy feature!  I don't know if any draw-back scenarios.  I use this feature all the time in another editor and frequently miss it when using Atom now...

It happens every time a line starts to get too long and the editor wants to make it multi-line.  So, given this line with this new feature, the enters can go in immediately after the `{`, `,`s

`this.setState({ wif_to_balances, balance_by_asset, balances_known: true ...`

Then instead of seeing this (the pipe is my cursor):

```
this.setState({
               | wif_to_balances, balance_by_asset, balances_known: true ...
```

One should see this:

```
this.setState({
               |wif_to_balances, balance_by_asset, balances_known: true ...
```

Small change but it cuts the work in 1/2 .. Also, I have yet to see a time when I really wanted to keep the white space after breaking a line with enter.

data.title: G-Sync monitor make atom lag
data.body:
Atom lag a lot when I'm using it on a nVidia G-Sync monitor. It appears on every electron based applications.
##### Some infos
- OS : Windows 7
- Works on my second monitor which is not G-Sync (extended desktop)
- Atom don't lag when doing a `Record Heap Allocations` profiling 
- WebGL games under Chrome are working fine on the G-Sync monitor
- `atom --safe` change nothing to the issue
##### For more informations, there is a thread there

https://discuss.atom.io/t/g-sync-windowed-screen-very-slow/20696
##### An issue on the electron repository

https://github.com/atom/electron/issues/2767

data.title: Dragging vertical line selection doesn't include the last line
data.body: Here I'm trying to remove the whitespace by selecting it vertically (`alt` + drag) and then dragging it to the left the last line is not included. What's in the gif: a) trying to select the white space vertically and deleting it -> the last line jumps b) placing multiple cursors and deleting the whitespace one by one going backwards (backspace) -> works, all cursors move in parallel ![a3itn5glr3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/171001/9813241/e7343a4e-587b-11e5-9d28-2b4fb96d9add.gif)

data.title: Atom crashes on startup with jemalloc preloaded
data.body:
Hello,

I'm unable to start Atom with jemalloc preloaded by means of /etc/ld.so.preload. The main window appears for a couple of seconds and then the app crashes. Console output is:

```
$ /usr/bin/atom: line 98:  4761 ***Segmentation fault      (core dumped)*** nohup "$ATOM_PATH" --executed-from="$(pwd)" --pid=$$ "$@" > "$ATOM_HOME/nohup.out" 2>&1
[4761:0911/125207:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(170)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/LinuxSUIDSandboxDevelopment for more information on developing with the sandbox on.
Gtk-Message: Failed to load module "pantheon-filechooser-module"
[4761:0911/125207:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(198)] GTK theme error: Unable to locate theme engine in module_path: "pixmap",
[4761:0911/125207:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(198)] GTK theme error: Unable to locate theme engine in module_path: "pixmap",
[4761:0911/125207:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(198)] GTK theme error: Unable to locate theme engine in module_path: "pixmap",
[4761:0911/125207:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(198)] GTK theme error: Unable to locate theme engine in module_path: "pixmap",
[4761:0911/125207:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(198)] GTK theme error: Unable to locate theme engine in module_path: "pixmap",
App load time: 201ms
ATTENTION: default value of option force_s3tc_enable overridden by environment.
[4795:0911/125208:INFO:renderer_main.cc(212)] Renderer process started
[4761:0911/125209:INFO:CONSOLE(11)] "activate linter-puppet", source: /home/ryan/.atom/packages/linter-puppet/lib/init.coffee (11)
Crash dump id: 1e66738c-49c4-4ce4-b267-ce8a2c10d891
Crash dump id: 9b64bbd7-b23c-41e6-b645-757e72e0f027
```

If I don't preload jemalloc when starting Atom, it works great.

I'm on elementary OS, using the .deb package on Atom's homepage.

data.title: noise sound when keep pressing ctl+cmd+⬆️／⬇️
data.body: noise sound when keep pressing ctl+cmd+⬆️／⬇️

data.title: Fix a typo in Electron URL
OSX atom fails to save a file
data.body:
Hi there, searched for open issues with "save".... 8 pages of results so hopefully this is not a duplicate.

OSX 10.10.5, rMBP

I edited a js file and pressed `cmd+s` to save the file. Atom indicated that it saved the file (the little blue ring in the title of the file disappeared). But in reality, the file wasn't saved. Opened it with Sublime to find out that file wasn't being saved. No matter how many times I try to save the file in atom, it wouldn't save...

Not using git/version control.

Kind of a huge issue. If you need any info, please let me know. It happened randomly. If you need any more logs, please let me know.

Also, I opened a minified bootstrap.js file with atom in the same workflow and atom was lagging when editing that file. Maybe opening a large file can make a difference?

data.title: :memo: CompositeDisposable is exported by event-kit, not atom
Pressing `ctrl` causes cursor to disappear
data.body:
Pressing `ctrl` (by itself or with hotkeys for cut/copy/paste/undo/etc.) causes cursor to disappear.  One must mouse click inside the pane to make the cursor reappear.

(movie gif available upon request)
## Repro Steps
1. Run atom (fresh)
2. Attempt to cut, copy, or paste text

**Expected:** Tap `ctrl` key and text cursor is still present

**Actual:** After tapping `ctrl` or using `ctrl + <any>` hotkey, one must click the mouse in the pane to get the cursor to reappear
## Versions
- **Atom:**       1.0.11
- **Atom-Shell:** 0.22.3
- **OS:**         linux 3.19.0-28-generic (Ubuntu 15.04)
- **Misc**
  - apm  1.0.4
  - npm  2.13.3
  - node 0.10.40
  - python 2.7.9
  - git 2.1.4
- **Packages**
  - linter-pylint@1.0.0 
  - Sass-Syntax-Highlight@0.1.1 
  - ScssBundle@0.5.0 
  - atom-beautify@0.28.11

data.title: Impossible to type a curly bracket / brace closing, on Windows with French keyboard
data.body:
Hi

I'm using atom editor on Windows, with a french keyboard.

When I'm using atom, it's impossible for me to type closing curly braces `}` in the editor. As you can see, they are working otherwise.

Curly brackets are typed with `alt-g =` on the french keyboard

![azerty](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/527245/9798563/0a9c8196-5802-11e5-86da-2380cdb3663e.png)

As you can imagine, this is quite annoying!

I don't see in my key bindings anything that could cause this issue:

![keybindings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/527245/9798585/34f1d98c-5802-11e5-90fd-69c9bf58c690.png)

Do you have any idea?

data.title: [WIP] Extract registry functions from squirrel-update
data.body:
This is a work-in-progress. When running _apm test_ (apart from a load of messages coming from other unrelated files) in the end it reports 3 failures, all related to _squirrel-update-spec.coffee_:

```
Windows squirrel updates
  it ignores errors spawning Squirrel
    Error: EBUSY
      at Object.<anonymous> (/my/path/atom/spec/squirrel-update-spec.coffee:30:54)
      at spawnUpdate (/my/path/atom/src/browser/squirrel-update.coffee:25:11)
      at createShortcuts (/my/path/atom/src/browser/squirrel-update.coffee:90:3)
      at Object.exports.handleStartupEvent (/my/path/atom/src/browser/squirrel-update.coffee:131:7)
      at [object Object].<anonymous> (/my/path/atom/spec/squirrel-update-spec.coffee:33:27)
  it quits the app on all squirrel events
    timeout: timed out after 5000 msec waiting for something to happen
  it keeps the desktop shortcut deleted on updates if it was previously deleted after install
    timeout: timed out after 5000 msec waiting for something to happen

Finished in 288.948 seconds
1838 tests, 6583 assertions, 3 failures, 0 skipped
```

I'd just like to stress that at the moment we're running this on a Mac, so not sure if those tests strictly depend on platform. Of course we'll move on a Win machine as soon as we grab one, next week probably.

data.title: rbenv: version `system' is not installed on saving SCSS files
data.body:
Using Atom 1.0.11. Whenever I save my `.scss` file, it throws error message:

```
rbenv: version `system' is not installed (set by RBENV_VERSION environment variable)
```

data.title: There should be a way to add a cursor via only keyboard if you don't want adjacent lines
data.body:
For example, lets say you want a cursor on two lines:

```
line one

line three
```

but there is a space in the middle.
It would be neat to be able to do ctrl+shift+numpad_number to add a cursor so many lines down.

Currently, I have to ctrl+click to get the cursors where I want.

if lines are adjacent (no space / empty line) between, then I can just use the 

```
'ctrl-shift-up': 'editor:add-selection-above'
'ctrl-shift-down': 'editor:add-selection-below'
```

from my config

data.title: Option to disable key binding tips
data.body: Could you please add a settings option to disable the "key binding" tips that are displayed in the main area when no files are open? Some may find them helpful. I find them very distracting.

data.title: Atom will be blocked when open the compress js file！！！
data.body: Sometime i will wait a long time, why atom is slow when format compress js file????
